item.title: I²C: Fundamentals and Practical Aspects of Inter-Integrated Circuit Communication
item.description: I²C is a synchronous, half-duplex, multi-master, multi-slave serial communication protocol developed by Philips (now NXP) in the 1980s. It was designed for on-board communication between integrated circuits, especially in systems with multiple low-speed peripherals controlled by a microcontroller.
